Course Description:
A systematic approach to the art of acting a speech that tells a story. Students develop several narrative speeches of audition length. Topics include Characterization, setting the Scene and Space; Character Traits and Behavioral Expression; Inner Conflict and Intention; Language, Objective/Obstacle, Build, and the Architecture of a speech. Speeches will vary from Contemporary to Period as well as texts not written specifically for the stage.


(Prerequisite: XXX)


Pre-requisite: THEA 120; or THEA 223
